hackathon-description-text: UNIHACK - Melbourne's premier student hackathon - is back on August 15 at Inspire9, Richmond.
hackathon-requirements:
You must submit your project by
In addition to the details about your project and how you built it, you must provide the following:
If you have created a web app, you are free to submit a link to a live working copy of your project with your submission. However, this is optional and not required.
hackathon-rules: Failure to comply with the Basic Rules can see you removed from the competition and/or expelled from the venue.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $3000 in cash, seats at PwC's prestigious Technology Academy, and every member of your team gets a Sphero 2.0 (worth AU$199.99 each)
Awarded to project with a good looking and very usable interface design. Prize: Adobe Creative Cloud for each team member.
Awarded to the project with the most original idea or reinvention. Prize: Parrot AR.Drone 2.0.
Awarded to the project that wins the hearts and minds (or the most votes) from the public. Prize: $100 JB Hi-Fi Gift Card for each team member.
Awarded to the project whose code quality soars above the competition despite the pressures of UNIHACK. Prize: Adruino Kit for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Least Hacky Hack (sponsored by Commonwealth Bank)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: At IMC, creative and innovative solutions are highly valued, and making them happen today is critical in maintaining our competitive edge. Prize: Apple Watch for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Making Things Happen Award (sponsored by IMC Pacific)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team that best solves a problem using mobile technology and features the best user experience and interface. Prize: Raspberry Pi for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Mobile Hack (sponsored by Outware Mobile)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team that can best uses Braintree/PayPal's APIs in their project. Prize: Developer Survival Kits (including PayPal Here) for each team member.
Awarded to the best project created by a team entirely made up of first year uni students. Prize: Mentoring session with an EY partner.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=41 Stewart Street, Richmond VIC 3121, Australia

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there any technical challenges to surmount when building it?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does it work as the creators say? Is it well designed?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfil a real need? Does it fulfil a real need people have?

hackathon-description-header: Eat. Sleep. Code. Can you build something awesome in 24 hours?
